perturbation.original_text: 2. Retention of Agent; Compensation; Sale and Delivery of the Shares. Subject to the terms and conditions herein set forth, the Company hereby appoints the Agent as a placement agent, on a non-exclusive basis, to utilize its "best efforts" to solicit subscriptions for the Shares and to assist the Company with respect to the Company's sale of the Shares in the Offering.
perturbation.changed_text: 2. Retention of Agent; Compensation; Sale and Delivery of the Shares. Subject to the terms and conditions herein set forth, the Company hereby appoints the Agent as a placement agent, on an exclusive basis, to utilize its "best efforts" to solicit subscriptions for the Shares and to assist the Company with respect to the Company's sale of the Shares in the Offering.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the Agent is appointed on a 'non-exclusive basis.' This change modifies it to 'exclusive basis,' directly contradicting Section 15, which states, 'This Agreement does not create an exclusive arrangement for the Agent.' This creates uncertainty regarding the Agent's exclusivity and the Company's ability to engage other agents.

perturbation.original_text: 8. Payment of Expenses. The Company covenants and agrees with the Agent that it will pay or cause to be paid the following: (i) the fees, disbursements and expenses of counsel to the Company and accountants in connection with the registration of the Shares under the Act and all other expenses in connection with the preparation, printing and filing of the Registration Statement, each Preliminary Prospectus, the Prospectus, each Permitted Free Writing Prospectus and any amendments or supplements thereto, and the mailing and delivering of copies thereof to the Agent and dealers; (ii) the cost of printing or reproducing this agreement, the Blue Sky Survey, any dealer agreements and any other documents in connection with the offering, purchase, sale and delivery of the Shares; (iii) all expenses in connection with the qualification of the Shares for offering and sale under state securities laws; (iv) the cost of preparing stock certificates; (v) all expenses related to road shows; (vi) the costs or expenses of any transfer agent or registrar; and (vi) all reasonable out-of-pocket fees and expenses of the Agent, including the reasonable fees and expenses of counsel for the Agent related to the Offering and not otherwise specifically provided for in this Section; the total for all such reasonable out-of-pocket fees and expenses shall not exceed $5,000 without the consent of the Company (exclusive of any blue sky-related fees if the Agent's counsel is requested to complete such services by the Company).
perturbation.changed_text: 8. Payment of Expenses. The Company covenants and agrees with the Agent that it will pay or cause to be paid the following: (i) the fees, disbursements and expenses of counsel to the Company and accountants in connection with the registration of the Shares under the Act and all other expenses in connection with the preparation, printing and filing of the Registration Statement, each Preliminary Prospectus, the Prospectus, each Permitted Free Writing Prospectus and any amendments or supplements thereto, and the mailing and delivering of copies thereof to the Agent and dealers; (ii) the cost of printing or reproducing this agreement, the Blue Sky Survey, any dealer agreements and any other documents in connection with the offering, purchase, sale and delivery of the Shares; (iii) all expenses in connection with the qualification of the Shares for offering and sale under state securities laws; (iv) the cost of preparing stock certificates; (v) all expenses related to road shows; (vi) the costs or expenses of any transfer agent or registrar; and (vi) all reasonable out-of-pocket fees and expenses of the Agent, including the reasonable fees and expenses of counsel for the Agent related to the Offering and not otherwise specifically provided for in this Section; the total for all such reasonable out-of-pocket fees and expenses shall not exceed $5,000 only if the offering is successful (exclusive of any blue sky-related fees if the Agent's counsel is requested to complete such services by the Company).
perturbation.explanation: By adding 'only if the offering is successful' to the expense reimbursement clause, it creates contradiction and therefore uncertainty about when Agent gets paid as section 2.b already guarantees payment 'regardless of whether the Offering is successfully completed.'
